channel.title: what other examples of "punishing" the player have you found in games?
channel.description: Albeit, it's a really low sum compared to the money you you usually have, but in some of the early parts of the game, it's bad. I find it discouraging when you're at a tougher point in the game it ends up costing you a good amount of money when it takes you a few attempts to get past it.

item.title: what other examples of "punishing" the player have you found in games?
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
In all seriousness, though, from what I’ve heard WarZ is worse than Activision in terms of money grubbing. Pay to play, pay to win, pay to respawn.

item.title: what other examples of "punishing" the player have you found in games?
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Isaacle:

Albeit, it’s a really low sum compared to the money you you usually have, but in some of the early parts of the game, it’s bad. I find it discouraging when you’re at a tougher point in the game it ends up costing you a good amount of money when it takes you a few attempts to get past it.

What kind of game are you playing that costs money when you fail?

Read full topic

item.title: what other examples of "punishing" the player have you found in games?
item.dc:creator: warpedfreeman
item.description:
System shock is good example, theres always low resources and must play it right to continue playing, the good thing is that you can backtrack to previus levels until some point to get more ammo/money from random npcs that respawn.
